content: m a d e b y m o o m e e n o m w s o g l c o w l the mwsogl cowl features an all-over moss stitch creating a beautifully warm and squishy texture perfect for snuggling up in on chilly days mwsogl is the welsh word for moss and the green in my first sample reminded me of the carpets of green moss covering every surface in my childhood home of wales the infinity cowl is worked flat from a provisional cast-on flat with a small ribbed edge before grafting the two ends together the cowl pattern is written for one size but the length can be easily adjusted from the recommended single twist to make a longer or shorter finished accessory finished circumference 150cm 60 finished height 30cm 12 size is adjustable by adding/reducing the number of row but finishing on a row 4 is recommended for the neatest grafting gauge 18 sts and 22 row = 10x10 cm 4x4 in textured pattern worked flat on 4 5 mm us size 7 needles blocked getting the same gauge is not crucial for this pattern but it may impact the amount of yarn you need and the finished size needle size 4 5 mm us size 7 or the required needles to obtain gauge and the fabric you like yarn 250g 460m / 505 yds dk to light worsted weight yarn abbreviations in one colour sample shows ístex spuni in colour 7229 k knit materials tapestry needle stitch marker blocking tools p purl waste yarn/floss/try-on cord sts stitches rs right side of work techniques provisional cast-on knit purl kitchener stitch ws wrong side of work knitting flat #madebymoomeeno #mwsogl #mwsoglcowl 1 m a d e b y m o o m e e n o provisional cast-on traditionally a provisional cast-on is worked into a crochet chain and there are many online tutorials showing this method to use try-on cords as an alternative method attach one end of your cord to the end of your needle and using a normal long- tail cast on cast on around both the needle and the try-on cord at the same time when you work your first row work the yarn on the needle leaving the try-on cord in place when you come to pick up the cast-on stitches at the end of your project for grafting you can simply pull a needle through using the cord as with other methods of provisional cast-on there are many online tutorials available instructions using your preferred method of provisional cast-on i prefer try-on cords cast-on 54 stitches the number of sts cast-on can be adjusted as
